result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd James Ludwig

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: State moves to dismiss matter due to defendant successfully complying w/terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, Court dismisses matter
to defendant re: payment of atty fees
Order for payment of attorney fees per itemized statement submitted by Atty Klopp

Defendant Todd James Ludwig in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1.  Court withheld adjudication.  Approved and entered into the 12 month DPA.  Ct. 2 dismissed but read in.  1 day of jail credit.

Defendant Todd James Ludwig in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have concerns with language in Deferred Prosecution Agreement.   Reset requested.  Return date scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Todd James Ludwig in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Klopp requesting new return date, bond cont'd  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List with Petition for Leave to file Additional Motions with discovery letter filed by Atty Kohlwey

Court called 9:29 am (Court adjourned 9:35 am). Defendant, Todd James Ludwig, appeared and sworn. Petition is reviewed. Court finds def conditionally indigent and appoints Atty Roger Klopp. Def to pay $100/mo starting 3/2/15 and the 2nd thereafter.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
copy of Public Defender Evaluation Form received.
Indigency hearing on February 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: No contact J.T.  No violent or abusive contact M.D.L.  Not possess any dangerous weapons.  Standard misd. conditions.

Defendant Todd James Ludwig by video, in custody with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $1000.00 signature bond.  No contact with J.T.  No violent or abusive contact with M.D.L.  Not to possess any dangerous weapons.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Standard misd. conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 11:20 am.  Hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
